content:
• Wednesday, February 8, 2012
  • SPRT

    More on Support.com (NASDAQ:SPRT): Q4 misses EPS estimates on impairment charges, but beats on...

    More on Support.com (NASDAQ:SPRT): Q4 misses EPS estimates on impairment charges, but beats on revenue. Profit jumped 20% Y/Y on strong revenue growth and significant improvement to bottom line margins. Shares +13.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 PM
  • QRVO

    More on TriQuint Semiconductor (TQNT): beats on its Q4, but the stock is down after hours after...

    More on TriQuint Semiconductor (TQNT): beats on its Q4, but the stock is down after hours after the company issues mixed guidance for Q1 2012. It now says Q1 earnings will be around $0.01 - $0.03 per share on revenue of between $210M - $220M. The Street is at $203M in revenue and earnings of $0.03 per share. Shares -9.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:06 PM

    Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML) guides on its Q4 earnings call for Q1 revenue of roughly $341M-$361M, below...

    Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML) guides on its Q4 earnings call for Q1 revenue of roughly $341M-$361M, below a $386M consensus. As a result, shares have given up their post-earnings gains, and are now down 2.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM
  • IRBT

    More on iRobot's Q4: The company forecasts Q1 revenue of $90M-$100M and EPS of -$0.08 to $0.00,...

    More on iRobot's Q4: The company forecasts Q1 revenue of $90M-$100M and EPS of -$0.08 to $0.00, well below a consensus of $120.6M and $0.30. Likewise, it expects 2012 revenue of $465M-$485M and EPS of $0.75-$0.95, below a consensus of $529.3M and $1.45. iRobot blames the soft guidance on "limited visibility" for its military robot business. IRBT -20.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • NBIX

    | 6:26 PM
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP), recently spun out of Expedia, falls 10.5% after reporting (.pdf) Q4...

    TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP), recently spun out of Expedia, falls 10.5% after reporting (.pdf) Q4 revenue of $137.8M (+30% Y/Y) and GAAP EPS of $0.16; the former beat by $4.1M. SG&A expenses rose 58% to $71.4M. 52% of TripAdvisor's sales came from the U.S., and 14% from the U.K. Ad sales accounted for 89% of revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • IRBT

    iRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $130.M (+14.7% Y/Y) misses by...

    iRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $130.M (+14.7% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -20.5% AH. (PR)

    Globecomm Systems (NASDAQ:GCOM): FQ2 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $95.2M (+35.6% Y/Y)...

    Globecomm Systems (NASDAQ:GCOM): FQ2 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $95.2M (+35.6% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares +7.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    Groupon's Q4 loss is evidence its business doesn't scale well, says Paulo Santos. While Facebook...

    Groupon's Q4 loss is evidence its business doesn't scale well, says Paulo Santos. While Facebook generated $3.7B in 2011 revenue with just 3,200 employees, and Google $37.9B in revenue with 32K employees, Groupon needed over 10K employees to generate revenue of $1.6B. The reason? Groupon needs to keep adding to its "army of salesmen" to produce more deals. GRPN -15.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM
  • GIL

    Gildan Activewear (NYSE:GIL): FQ1 EPS of -$0.38 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $303.8M (-8.3% Y/Y)...

    Gildan Activewear (NYSE:GIL): FQ1 EPS of -$0.38 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $303.8M (-8.3% Y/Y) beats by $3.8M. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)

    Innodata Isogen (INOD +25%), a provider of editorial and digital publishing services, took off...

    Innodata Isogen (INOD +25%), a provider of editorial and digital publishing services, took off today after reporting Q4 revenue of $23.7M (+59% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.09. The company is also guiding for revenue of $21M in seasonally weak Q1, and says it expects its new data analysis services business to start generating revenue in the first half.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM

    Diodes (NASDAQ:DIOD): Q4 EPS of $0.09 in-line. Revenue of $143.3M (-12.5% Y/Y) misses by $3M....

  • AFFX

    More on Affymetrix (NASDAQ:AFFX): Q4 posts a big miss as as losses increase on significantly...

    More on Affymetrix (NASDAQ:AFFX): Q4 posts a big miss as as losses increase on significantly lower revenue across all segments. Product revenue was just $58M for the quarter, compared to Q4 2010 when came in at $71.9M. Shares -9.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) guides on its Q4 earnings call for Q1 revenue of $305M-$313 and EPS of...

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) guides on its Q4 earnings call for Q1 revenue of $305M-$313 and EPS of $0.36-$0.39; the latter is mostly below a $0.39 consensus, but the former is above a Street forecast of $304.8M. Shares are now +13.8% AH. LLNW +6% in sympathy.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • AFFX

    Affymetrix (NASDAQ:AFFX): Q4 EPS of -$0.21 misses by $0.14. Revenue of $65.1M (+-23.3% Y/Y)...

  • SNBR

    Select Comfort  (SCSS) beats estimates with its top-line and bottom-line Q4 results, driven...

    Select Comfort  (SCSS) beats estimates with its top-line and bottom-line Q4 results, driven by company-controlled comparable sales growth of 31%. For FY12, the bed and mattress maker expects to see comparable sales growth of at least 15% and increase its in store count to between 400-410 by year-end from a current level of 381. Shares +6.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • CSCO

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) guides on its FQ2 earnings call (webcast) for FQ3 revenue growth of 5%-7%...

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) guides on its FQ2 earnings call (webcast) for FQ3 revenue growth of 5%-7% and EPS of $0.45-$0.47 (consensus of 5.5% and $0.45). Investors seem disappointed, shares are now -0.2% AH. Also mentioned: Cisco's switching revenue rose 8% Y/Y in FQ2, while routing revenue rose 11% (market share gains claimed). Data center revenue (UCS servers) rose 88%. Product gross margin fell slightly, due to a mix shift. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • CZR

    Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR) surged in its first day of trading, +71% to $15.39 from its...

    Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR) surged in its first day of trading, +71% to $15.39 from its IPO price of $9. It sold only 1.8M shares, or about 1.4% of its shares outstanding, making the stock vulnerable to large price swings as it traded.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) resumes trading after announcing it will restate two years of...

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) resumes trading after announcing it will restate two years of financials and the firing of its CEO and CFO. Shares -38.1%. Can an announcement from Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) that its sale of Pringles to Diamond has been called off be far behind?

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 16 Comments
  • FMC

    FMC Corp. (NYSE:FMC): Q4 EPS of $1.58 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $908.6M (+12.1% Y/Y) beats by...

    FMC Corp. (NYSE:FMC): Q4 EPS of $1.58 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $908.6M (+12.1% Y/Y) beats by $25M. Shares +2.9% AH. (PR)

  • IRBT

    Shares of iRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT) lose 21.1% in AH trading after the robot maker reports Q4 revenue...

    Shares of iRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT) lose 21.1% in AH trading after the robot maker reports Q4 revenue of $130.M (+14.7%) that came in below the consensus mark analysts set for $134.8M. The company warns that it expects a falloff in top and bottom line results in its G&I division in 2012 due to limited visibility for its defense business.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • SIX

    Six Flags (NYSE:SIX) gains 2.5% AH after increasing its quarterly dividend 10-fold, to...

    Six Flags (NYSE:SIX) gains 2.5% AH after increasing its quarterly dividend 10-fold, to $0.60/share. Following the hike, Six Flags sports an annual yield of 5.5%. The company announced a new $250M stock buyback last month. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • ON

    ON Semiconductor (ONNN): Q4 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $767.9M (+32.6% Y/Y) beats...

    ON Semiconductor (ONNN): Q4 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $767.9M (+32.6% Y/Y) beats by $8M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • DMND

    More on Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): In response to its audit committee's findings, Diamond is...

    More on Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): In response to its audit committee's findings, Diamond is firing CEO Michael Mendes and CFO Steven Neil. Director Rick Wolford will serve as CEO, and Alix Partners' Michael Murphy will serve as CFO, until full-time replacements are found. Diamond shares are halted, and will resume trading at 4:50 PM ET. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • CSCO

    More on Cisco's FQ2: $466M worth of shares repurchased at average price of $17.84. The company...

    More on Cisco's FQ2: $466M worth of shares repurchased at average price of $17.84. The company is boosting its quarterly dividend by $0.02 to $0.08/share. Revenue growth represents a sharp acceleration from FQ1's 4.7% increase. Operating cash flow rose 19% Y/Y to $3.1B. Gross margin was 62.4%, roughly flat Y/Y. R&D expenses fell 9%. (CC webcast). CSCO +3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • GRPN

    More on Groupon's Q4: North American revenue rose 113% Y/Y, international revenue rose 279%....

    More on Groupon's Q4: North American revenue rose 113% Y/Y, international revenue rose 279%. Free cash flow was $155.1M. Gross billings were $1.25B, up 200% Y/Y. Active customer base was 33M at year's end, up 20% Q/Q. Groupon expects Q1 revenue of $510M-$550M, above a $500.9M consensus. It expects operating income of $15M-$35M, up from Q4's $15M. GRPN -10.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM

    | 4:10 PM

    | 4:10 PM | 4 Comments

    | 4:09 PM
  • MITK

    Mitek Systems (MITK +18.3%), a developer of image correction and character recognition software,...

    Mitek Systems (MITK +18.3%), a developer of image correction and character recognition software, closes up strong after reporting FQ1 revenue $3.5M (+151% Y/Y) and breakeven EPS. Mitek claims it now has 56 customers for its Mobile Deposit solution, which allows users to deposit checks by taking pictures using their smartphone's camera.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • S

    Sprint's (S -1.8%) slightly better-than-expected quarter, weighed by heavy spending to support...

    Sprint's (S -1.8%) slightly better-than-expected quarter, weighed by heavy spending to support iPhone sales, doesn't seem to have changed any Street minds: the $15.5B Sprint spent is either money well spent or it isn't. "We're ahead of the game," CEO Dan Hesse says, with iPhones sold in the quarter "significantly higher" than expected and continuing to sell well.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • CNVR

    ValueClick (VCLK +6.3%) moves higher after beating Q4 estimates late yesterday. Revenue jumped...

    ValueClick (VCLK +6.3%) moves higher after beating Q4 estimates late yesterday. Revenue jumped 42% Y/Y due largely to strong performance from its recent acquisitions. The company also says Q1 EPS will be above Street expectations, now expecting $0.34 - $0.35 per share, versus consensus estimates of $0.23.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • CERN

    Cerner's (CERN +13.4%) strong Q4 (I, II) is providing a lift to other healthcare IT names. MDRX...

    Cerner's (CERN +13.4%) strong Q4 (I, II) is providing a lift to other healthcare IT names. MDRX +4.1%. MRGE +1.2%. CPSI +2.7%. Quality Systems (QSII +3.6%), meanwhile, might also be getting a boost from a UBS note claiming management struck a bullish tone at a recent conference. (CERN transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • WYN

    Wyndham Worldwide (WYN +5.6%) moves up after its Q4 beat Street estimates earlier today. Net...

    Wyndham Worldwide (WYN +5.6%) moves up after its Q4 beat Street estimates earlier today. Net earnings fell 28% Y/Y on a write-down in its lodging business, but core earnings were ahead of forecasts. The company also announced a 53% increase in its quarterly dividend to $0.23 from $0.15 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • GRPN

    "So who leaked the Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) number," tweets Leo Isaak, noticing the 4% move higher...

    "So who leaked the Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) number," tweets Leo Isaak, noticing the 4% move higher in the past 25 minutes. Q4 results are due after the bell.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTGR

    Netgear (NTGR -6%) dips after Deutsche cuts the shares to Hold from Buy, noting the company's...

    Netgear (NTGR -6%) dips after Deutsche cuts the shares to Hold from Buy, noting the company's plans to increase operating expenses may hamper its ability to exhibit further operating leverage.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources (DNR -2.5%) is lowered to Neutral from Positive by Susquehanna following a 35%...

    Denbury Resources (DNR -2.5%) is lowered to Neutral from Positive by Susquehanna following a 35% share price increase since mid-December. The oil and natural gas company has already reported 2011 reserves and has low balance sheet leverage to higher oil prices, the firm says, eliminating two catalysts that could raise shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • VSH

    Vishay Intertechnology (VSH +5.3%) gets a pop from a JP Morgan upgrade to Overweight, noting...

    Vishay Intertechnology (VSH +5.3%) gets a pop from a JP Morgan upgrade to Overweight, noting potential for a solid Q2 as demand for passive electronic components and discrete semiconductors may have reached a bottom.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • HMN

    Horace Mann Educators (HMN +4.8%) jumps after its Q4 results beat Street estimates earlier. Net...

    Horace Mann Educators (HMN +4.8%) jumps after its Q4 results beat Street estimates earlier. Net income grew, due in large part to improved property and casualty segment earnings. The company also confirmed earnings guidance at the high end of its range, beating the Street consensus view.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • ICE

    IntercontinentalExchange (ICE +6.5%) moves higher after its Q4 EPS beat expectations earlier...

    IntercontinentalExchange (ICE +6.5%) moves higher after its Q4 EPS beat expectations earlier today. Revenue grew 15% Y/Y, and the company expects it to grow by at least 10% in 2012 as well, thanks to rising commodity derivatives demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • BAC

    Fairholme Funds' Bruce Berkowitz reaffirms his confidence in Bank of America (BAC +3.3%), saying...

    Fairholme Funds' Bruce Berkowitz reaffirms his confidence in Bank of America (BAC +3.3%), saying "it doesn’t get any better when it comes to value investing" in noting tangible book value of $12-$13/share and earnings power of $4/share. On ongoing BofA litigation, he says the bank already has reserved for most of any settlement money. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 13 Comments
  • JNY

    Jones Apparel Group (JNY +4.6%) gains despite posting a mixed Q4, beating on a per share basis...

    Jones Apparel Group (JNY +4.6%) gains despite posting a mixed Q4, beating on a per share basis but coming up short on revenue. Net losses narrowed during the quarter on a combination of marginal revenue growth and significantly reduced input costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • KFRC

    Shares of Kforce (KFRC +9.9%) rallies hard off of the firm's Q4 earnings beat. CEO David Dunkel...

    Shares of Kforce (KFRC +9.9%) rallies hard off of the firm's Q4 earnings beat. CEO David Dunkel attributes the online staffing company's recent growth to a "secular shift" toward a more flexible staffing model, with more jobs manned through temporary staffing.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • HCSG

    Healthcare Services Group (HCSG +7.2%) gets a boost from a better than expected Q4 despite...

    Healthcare Services Group (HCSG +7.2%) gets a boost from a better than expected Q4 despite narrower margins, as revenue growth jumped 23% Y/Y. Net earnings also rose 16% over the previous period, as the company has continually reported top and bottom line quarterly growth for nearly two years.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • LEAF

    Demand Media (DMD -6.3%) tumbles following a downgrade to Underweight from Morgan Stanley's...

    Demand Media (DMD -6.3%) tumbles following a downgrade to Underweight from Morgan Stanley's Scott Devitt, who notes a new round of Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) algorithm changes has led to a drop in unique visitors for Demand's sites. Moreover, Devitt sees Demand's attempts to spend more on content (with the goal of shedding its "content farm" image) hurting profits. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • SNTS

    Santarus (SNTS -5.2%) trades lower as investors line it up one of the biopharmaceutical...

    Santarus (SNTS -5.2%) trades lower as investors line it up one of the biopharmaceutical companies that could get hit by the FDA's warning letter on stomach-acid medications.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • JOY

    Shares of Joy Global (JOY -2.9%) move lower after UBS removes the company from its Key Call List...

    Shares of Joy Global (JOY -2.9%) move lower after UBS removes the company from its Key Call List on worries about the outlook for U.S. thermal coal.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • JIVE

    Though its Q4 report beat estimates, Jive Software (JIVE -3.3%) is selling off, perhaps thanks...

    Though its Q4 report beat estimates, Jive Software (JIVE -3.3%) is selling off, perhaps thanks to its ho-hum Q1 guidance (revenue of $23.5M-$24.5M and EPS of -$0.13 to -$0.14 vs. consensus of $22.9M and -$0.14). However, Jive's full-year guidance is solid (revenue of $108M-$112M and EPS of -$0.40 to -$0.45 vs. consensus of $104.8M and EPS of -$0.49). UBS (Neutral) remains concerned about Jive's high valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM | 2 Comments
  • AET

    Shares of Coventry Health Care (CVH -2%) sag after posting a mixed Q4, beating on revenue but...

    Shares of Coventry Health Care (CVH -2%) sag after posting a mixed Q4, beating on revenue but missing on a per share basis. Net earnings fell 43% Y/Y on a decline in enrollment, but was offset somewhat by lighter use of health-care products and services by consumers and lower than expected SG&A expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -2.6%) slumps after Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) announces its anticipated Prime Video...

    Netflix (NFLX -2.6%) slumps after Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) announces its anticipated Prime Video deal with Viacom (VIA, VIAB). The deal adds over 2K titles from cable networks such as Nickelodeon, MTV, and Comedy Central, and boosts the size of Amazon's library to 15K (Netflix has 20K+). Ryan Lawler believes Prime Video now looks like a real competitor to Netflix, but thinks a standalone service is needed.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • AONEQ

    After tumbling yesterday on news that top customer Fisker Automotive is stopping work on its...

    After tumbling yesterday on news that top customer Fisker Automotive is stopping work on its Nina electric sedan and attempting to renegotiate a DOE loan, A123 Systems (AONE +8.5%) is rebounding today. Fisker's woes have taken a toll on A123; its shares fell last month after Fisker cut its 2012 production forecast for its Karma sports car.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • CTSH
